title: OpenShift Virtualization Specialist (EX316) â€” Mock 5: Full Spectrum Review
description: This exam is a comprehensive review of all major domains, requiring you to switch between different skill sets quickly.

tasks.title: Deploy a web server VM and configure its service

sections.title: VM and Service Provisioning
sections.notice: Deploy a VM named 'web-final-vm' and expose it internally.
subtasks: Provision 'web-final-vm' from the RHEL9 template with 2 CPUs and 2Gi memory.
Inside the VM, install the 'httpd' package and start the service.
Create a ClusterIP service named 'web-final-svc' that exposes port 80 on the VM.

tasks.title: Configure a custom Route for the web server

sections.title: Customized External Access
sections.notice: Expose the 'web-final-svc' service externally at the hostname 'webapp-final.apps.example.com'.
subtasks: Create a Route resource that targets the 'web-final-svc' service.
Set the hostname of the route to 'webapp-final.apps.example.com'.
Verify the web server is accessible via this custom hostname.

tasks.title: Add a secondary data disk to the web server VM

sections.title: Add Persistent Storage
sections.notice: Add a 15Gi disk for web content.
subtasks: Create a 15Gi PVC named 'web-content-pvc'.
Add the PVC as a new data volume to the 'web-final-vm'.
Log into the VM and create a filesystem on the new disk.

tasks.title: Create a snapshot of the web server VM

sections.title: State Backup
sections.notice: Take a snapshot of 'web-final-vm' before making further changes.
subtasks: Create a VirtualMachineSnapshot named 'web-final-snapshot' for the VM.
Wait for the snapshot to be ready to use.

tasks.title: Clone the web server VM for a development environment

sections.title: Cloning
subtasks: Create a clone of 'web-final-vm'.
Name the new VM 'web-dev-vm'.
Verify the new VM starts and is a perfect copy.

tasks.title: Configure a secondary network for the development VM

sections.title: Isolate Development VM
sections.notice: Connect 'web-dev-vm' to an isolated bridge network named 'dev-net'.
subtasks: Create a NetworkAttachmentDefinition for a bridge network named 'dev-net'.
Edit 'web-dev-vm' to add a new network interface.
Attach the new interface to the 'dev-net' NAD.

tasks.title: Create a custom template from the development VM

sections.title: Template Generation
subtasks: Shut down the 'web-dev-vm'.
Generate a new template from the VM.
Ensure the template is named 'dev-webtier-template'.

tasks.title: Use the new template to deploy a QA VM with cloud-init

sections.title: Template Deployment and Customization
sections.notice: Deploy 'web-qa-vm' and use cloud-init to set its hostname.
subtasks: Deploy a new VM named 'web-qa-vm' from 'dev-webtier-template'.
Use cloud-init user data to set the hostname to 'qa.example.com'.
Verify the VM boots and has the correct hostname.

tasks.title: Perform a live migration of the production web server

sections.title: Live Migration
sections.notice: Move 'web-final-vm' to a different worker node without downtime.
subtasks: Initiate a live migration for 'web-final-vm'.
Monitor the migration and verify it completes successfully.
Confirm the VM is running on a new node.

tasks.title: Configure a readiness probe for the production web server

sections.title: Health Check
sections.notice: Add a readiness probe to 'web-final-vm' to verify httpd is running.
subtasks: Edit the 'web-final-vm' resource.
Add a readiness probe that performs an HTTP GET request on port 80.
Verify the VMI enters the 'Ready' state.

tasks.title: Backup the production web server using OADP

sections.title: OADP Backup
subtasks: Ensure the OADP operator is configured.
Create a 'Backup' resource that includes the 'web-final-vm'.
Verify the backup operation completes successfully.

tasks.title: Restore the backup to a new VM

sections.title: OADP Restore
sections.notice: Restore the backup of 'web-final-vm' to a new VM named 'web-restored-vm'.
subtasks: Create a 'Restore' resource from the backup.
Configure the restore to change the name of the restored VM to 'web-restored-vm'.
Verify the new VM is created and functional.

tasks.title: Prepare a node for maintenance by draining it

sections.title: Node Maintenance
sections.notice: A worker node needs to be rebooted. Safely drain it of all VMs.
subtasks: Select a worker node running at least one VM.
Use 'oc adm drain' to gracefully evict all VMs.
Verify the VMs are migrated to other nodes.

tasks.title: Configure anti-affinity for a new pair of database VMs

sections.title: High Availability Pair
sections.notice: Deploy two new database VMs, 'db-a' and 'db-b', and ensure they run on separate nodes.
subtasks: Deploy 'db-a' with the label 'db-pair=ha'.
Deploy 'db-b' with the same label.
Add a required pod anti-affinity rule to both VMs to prevent them from co-locating.

tasks.title: Configure a service to load balance between the new database VMs

sections.title: Load Balancing
sections.notice: Create a single service that balances traffic across 'db-a' and 'db-b'.
subtasks: Create a ClusterIP service named 'db-ha-svc'.
Configure a selector that targets both VMs using the 'db-pair=ha' label.
Verify the service endpoints include the IP addresses of both VMs.
